    Ansong Ni

    About Me

    Hi! I am Ansong Ni (倪安松), a second-year Ph.D. student in the Computer Science Department at Yale University working with Prof. Dragomir Radev in the LILY lab. Prior to Yale, I obtained my M.S. in CS degree from School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University and B.Eng. from Nanjing University in China.

    I worked as a research intern at Microsoft Research Redmond (Summer 2021), Allen Institute for AI (AI2) (Summer 2020), Institute for Software Research at CMU (Spring 2020), Microsoft Research Asia (Summer, Fall 2017). I will be interning at Meta AI for Summer 2022.

    Research Interest

    I am generally interested in natural language processing and machine learning. My long-term research goal is to build a system that can understand human's intention and parse it into machine-executable form. Motivated by this goal, I am mainly interested in the following topics (in order):

    • Semantic Parsing | Code Generation | Program Synthesis
    • Question Answering | Reading Comprehension | Logical Reasoning
    • Neural-Symbolic Learning | Reinforcement Learning

    Miscellaneous

    • My first name can be pronounce as-is: [An-Song], last name is like [Nee].
    • I love soccer and I am a Barcelona fan. For NBA, I support whichever team that is closest to where I live, right now it’s Brooklyn Nets.
    • I am from Nanchang, Jiangxi Province in China. I’ve also lived in Nanjing, Beijing, Berkeley, Pittsburgh, Houston, and most recently, New Haven.
